channel.title: CVE Feed for rilwis -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for rilwis -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-29442|2024-08-03T06:26:04.879Z -- rilwis -- private%20messages%20for%20wordpress%20%28wordpress%20plugin%29
item.description: Authenticated (subscriber or higher user role) Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Messages For WordPress <= 2.1.10 at WordPress.

item.title: CVE-2022-29441|2024-08-03T06:26:04.868Z -- rilwis -- private%20messages%20for%20wordpress%20%28wordpress%20plugin%29
item.description: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in Private Messages For WordPress plugin <= 2.1.10 at WordPress allows attackers to send messages.

item.title: CVE-2023-6526|2024-08-02T08:35:14.008Z -- rilwis -- meta%20box%20%E2%80%93%20wordpress%20custom%20fields%20framework
item.description: The Meta Box – WordPress Custom Fields Framework plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via custom post meta values displayed through the plugin's shortcode in all versions up to, and including, 5.9.2 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2023-6526|2024-02-05T21:21:37.891Z -- rilwis -- meta%20box%20%E2%80%93%20wordpress%20custom%20fields%20framework
item.description: The Meta Box – WordPress Custom Fields Framework plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via custom post meta values displayed through the plugin's shortcode in all versions up to, and including, 5.9.2 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.description: The Meta Box – WordPress Custom Fields Framework plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via custom post meta values displayed through the plugin's shortcode in all versions up to, and including, 5.9.2 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
